summary: Västmanland County is a significant administrative region within Sweden, classified under the category of "regions of EU Member States." In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, Västmanland plays a crucial role in regional governance and development policies. It is subject to various EU regulations that aim to promote cohesion and sustainable growth among member states. The county's administrative structure facilitates the implementation of EU directives at the local level, ensuring compliance with overarching EU legal standards. As a regional entity, Västmanland contributes to the broader objectives of the EU, including economic integration and social inclusion.
